update.description:
In current versions of pandas and lyse, in normal use the majority of dataframe
columns that can be are already specific datatypes and not 'object', so there is
limited performance improvement to the convert_objects call, and so not much downside
to removing it without a replacement.

Some colums that were temporarily a mixed datatype (due to the analysis
results being saved by single shot routines changing type) will remain dtype
object even if all the entries are later of the same type, which is not ideal.

This should be rare and so not likely to be a performance problem, which was the
original purpose of adding convert_objects. But these columns may appear differently
from the perspective of multishot routines, and some code may not be able to handle
them. However we will see empirically if this causes any problems, as perhaps
all relevant code can in fact handle columns with dtype object fine, so we shouldn't
fix what isn't broken until we know it actually is.

Would be interested in testing to see that existing analysis routines don't run into trouble after this patch.
update.title: Fix for issue #52. Remove deprecated convert_objects() call

pull_request.title: Fix for issue #52. Remove deprecated convert_objects() call

pullrequest.title: Fix for issue #52. Remove deprecated convert_objects() call

content.raw:
Update: this now just does `infer_objects` instead. Should be a 1:1 replacement for how we were using `convert_objects`

The now-deleted comment about not converting to specific dtypes earlier to not prevent the user from using mixed dtypes is no longer relevant. `update_row` will now convert a  column to dtype 'object' if it encounters an incompatible type when modifying the dataframe. So there is no longer any reason not to replace lyse's dataframe with the converted version. This should improve performance slightly as it won't be doing the same conversions over and over. 

Have confirmed that lyse's required pandas version is high enough to ensure `infer_objects` exists.
content.html:
Update: this now just does infer_objects instead. Should be a 1:1 replacement for how we were using convert_objects

The now-deleted comment about not converting to specific dtypes earlier to not prevent the user from using mixed dtypes is no longer relevant. update_row will now convert a column to dtype 'object' if it encounters an incompatible type when modifying the dataframe. So there is no longer any reason not to replace lyse's dataframe with the converted version. This should improve performance slightly as it won't be doing the same conversions over and over.

Have confirmed that lyse's required pandas version is high enough to ensure infer_objects exists.

pull_request.title: Fix for issue #52. Remove deprecated convert_objects() call
